description:
In this class, we will compare DNA from an individual against a reference human genome to find potentially disease-causing mutations. We will also learn how to identify the function of a protein even if it has been bombarded by so many mutations compared to similar proteins with known functions that it has become barely recognizable.

                                            Syllabus
                        Week 1How Do We Locate Disease-Causing Mutations? (Week 1/3)Week 2How Do We Locate Disease-Causing Mutations? (Week 2/3)Week 3How Do We Locate Disease-Causing Mutations? (Week 3/3)Week 4Why Have Biologists Still Not Developed an HIV Vaccine? (Week 1/2)Week 5Why Have Biologists Still Not Developed an HIV Vaccine? (Week 2/2)Week 6Bioinformatics Application Challenge!
title: Finding Mutations in DNA and Proteins (Bioinformatics VI)
